A person free of the enchantment must make a persuasion check against either the spell's DC to get everyone in the area to take notice, or may attempt to focus on a single person as an action to force that person to attempt to no longer ignore the Dirge. (prompting a saving throw).
Once a creature has successfully saved they see you (the Dirge) and cannot be effected by another Ignore channel for a day, and gain advantage on all future attempts to force them to ignore.
at each subsquent dirge level you may exchange your current channel ability for a different one.

subclassFeature.name: Yeah... Whatever
entries: Beginning at 10th level, when making a saving throw against an ability that deals Psychic damage or imposes the Charm, Frightened, or condition. You may choose to take a level of exhaustion to automatically succeed provided the Charmed, or Frighted condition effect have not yet been applied.

subclassFeature.name: Life?... meh.
entries: The archetypal Champion focuses on the development of raw physical power honed to deadly perfection. Those who model themselves on this archetype combine rigorous training with physical excellence to deal devastating blows.

entries.name: Improved Critical
entries: Beginning when you choose this archetype at 3rd level, your weapon attacks score a critical hit on a roll of 19 or 20.

subclassFeature.name: Delayed Gratification
entries: You get nothing. That's the way that goes - you have to make the choice and see what comes from your choices. Later on.

subclassFeature.name: Divine Filler
entries: Choose one of the following:

entries.name: Channel Dysfunction: Pauli Effect
entries: Things break down, don't work, more so around you. When you channel all other creatures within 30 ft. of you immediately lose attunement to their magical item(s).

entries.name: Channel Dysfunction: Juxtaposition
entries: Things never make sense, but then again they shouldn't obviously we're not here for {@i a reason} we're just here, wherever that is. As either a bonus action or a reaction you may channel this power, make a ranged to hit roll for a creature or object that you can see or know its absolute position (are very familiar with) within 100 ft. You and that target change places. If the creature is hostile, it gets a Dexterity Save to avoid being shifted, and instead, you appear in its square crowding it.

entries.name: Channel Dysfunction: Leech
entries: {@i Requires Concentration}

You not only suck the fun out events, you suck the very luck from the room as well. When you channel this you create a 20'ft radius aura. All creatures except you in the radius have a -d4 for all their Ability, Skill, and initative checks. Damage amounts are also reduced by 1. The effect last for 1 minute or until concentration is broken.
at each subsquent dirge level you may exchange your current channel ability for a different one.

The Pauli effect is a term referring to the apparently mysterious, anecdotal failure of technical equipment in the presence of Austrian theoretical physicist Wolfgang Pauli. The term was coined using his name after numerous instances in which demonstrations involving equipment suffered technical problems only when he was present

subclassFeature.name: Entrophic Ward
entries: Beginning at 10th level, you learn to magically ward yourself against attack and to turn an enemy's failed strike into good luck for yourself, When a creature makes an attack roll against you, you can use your reaction to impose disadvantage on that roll. If the attack misses you, before the end of your text turn your next attack roll against that creature has advantage. On a critical fail against you, you regain a use of enervation.
{@i You may use this feature (Int Modifier) times every short or long rest.}

subclassFeature.name: Solipsism
entries: Starting at 14th level, as an action you create an extra-natural force. The Dirge and whomever he informs of his intent must make a Wisdom save against the Dirge's Charisma ability score as the DC. On a successful save all those that succeeded experience the Solipsism as real. Unlike true illusions, the image created by this spell does more than just duplicate reality. The image formed is real for those who believe in it. The illusion has all the normal properties that its form and function allow. Thus, a solipsistic bridge spanning a chasm could be crossed by the dirge and those who believed. All others would see the priest apparently walking out onto nothingness. A Solipsism of a barrier would block a dragon's breath weapon. Creatures are not affected (the dragon) by the Solipsism would be able to move through the object as if doesn't exist (because, to them - it does not).
Solipsism can create only illusions that are external to the Dirge. Thus, the Dirge cannot create an illusion that he is the size of a giant, is unwounded, or has sprouted wings

entries.name: Improved Critical
entries: Beginning when you choose this archetype at 3rd level, your weapon attacks score a critical hit on a roll of 19 or 20.

subclassFeature.name: Alchemist
entries: Alchemicy są mistrzami mikstur, eliksirów i odczynników, potrafią tworzyć mikstury szybciej niż inni Artylerzyści i są uzdolnieni w zwiększaniu potencjału stworzeń. Mają pewne zdolności lecznicze, a w połączeniu z Agentem Minionem stanowią skuteczny środek przenoszenia na pole walki.

subclassFeature.name: Bonus Proficiency
entries: You gain proficiency with the {@item Alchemist Kit|phb} & {@item Glassblower's Tools|phb}. If you already have this proficiency, you gain expertise.

subclassFeature.name: Bonus Infusion
entries: You gain 1 additional Infusion with each level.
{@i The infusion must be of the type "Consumable".}

subclassFeature.name: Alchemist's Knowledge
entries: At 1st level, you learn the either Acid or Potion of Health and the Potion of¹.. Infusions.

items: {@b At 5th level}, you learn *Potion of²..* Infusion.
{@b At 9th level}, you learn *Potion of³..* or the *Flashbang Infusion* Infusions.
{@b At 13th level}, you learn *Potion of⁴..* or the *Potion of Vitality* Infusions.
{@b At 17th level}, you learn *Potion of⁵..* or the *Bottled Storm* Infusion.

subclassFeature.name: Quick and Unstable Consumables
entries: At 1st level you are able to spend a bonus action to create a consumable potion that cost one less infusion point (down to zero), and degrades into uselessness at the end of your turn. The Unstable Consumable may be generated as powerful as if you had spent two points at 6th level, and as powerful as if four points at 14th level.
Acid, Alchemist's Fire, Alchemist's Frost, Holy Water, Holywrath Stone, ICB, Poison, Sympathetic Balm, Phosphorus Stick, Tanglefoot Bag, Thunderstone, or Universal Antidote for no infusion cost.
The Unstable Consumable created degrade into uselessness at end of your turn.

items: {@b At 5th level}, you may pick another from the additional Unstable Consumable list.
{@b At 10th level}, you add another Unstable Consumable List; which now expands to include: *Alchemist's Acid*, *Greasebomb*, and *Smokebomb*.
{@b At 15th level}, you add another Unstable Consumable that you've figured out how to quickly craft.

subclassFeature.name: Combine Consumables
entries: At 3rd level,

subclassFeature.name: Combine Consumables
entries: At 6th level, when you create a Consumable, you can create a single Consumable out of the effects of two Consumables. If both Consumables require a ranged attack, you resolve the Consumable with a single attack roll.

For example, you can spend 2 points on an Acid effect, and 2 point on an Alchemist's Fire effect. On a hit, this Consumable would deal 4d6 + 2 acid damage, and cause the target to begin taking 1d4 fire damage at the start of each of its turns. (Note normally mixing magical potions results in very possible Miscibility Misfires See DMG)

items: {@b At 14th level}, you can combine 3 Consumable effects.

subclassFeature.name: Enhanced Consumables
entries: At 11th level, the dice used by your manufactured Consumables increases by 1 size. (d4 increases to d6, d6 increases to d8, d8 increases to d10, d10 increases to d12, and d12 increases to 2d8).

subclassFeature.name: Healing Infusion
entries: At 14th level, whenever you create a potion, you can also infuse it with one of the following effects:

items: {@b Curative Admixture}, The character that drinks the potion heals 1 hit points per Infusion Point spent on the potion.

{@b Resistive Formula}, The character that drinks the potion gains resistance to acid, cold, fire, force, lightning, necrotic, poison, psychic, radiant,
or thunder damage until the start
of your next turn.

{@b Shielding Elixir}, The character
that drinks the potion gains 1
temporary hit point per Infusion
Point it cost.

subclassFeature.name: Chemical Mastery
entries: By 20th level, you create two of that consumable for the expense.

subclassFeature.name: Arcane Engineer
entries: Arcane Engineers są bardziej skupieni na inżynierii schematów zaklęć niż na formułach infuzji. Wymieniają część swojej zdolności do produkcji magicznych urządzeń na potencjał rzucania czarów. Są kiepskim czarodziejem, ale są jedynym Artificerem, który posiada bezpośrednią, natychmiastową zdolność rzucania zaklęć.

entries.subclassFeature: Arcane Engineer's Additional Spell List|Artificer|MMMxArtificer|Arcane Engineer|MMMxArtificer|1

subclassFeature.name: Bonus Proficiency
entries: You gain proficiency in Arcana (or expertise if already proficient).

subclassFeature.name: Cantrip
entries: You learn two Cantrips from the following list: {@spell Gust}, {@spell Control Flames}, {@spell Mage Hand}, {@spell Magic Stone}, or {@spell Light}

subclassFeature.name: Arcane Knowledge
entries: You learn three 1st-level spells of your choice from either the Wizard or the Expanded spell list below.
You learn an additional spell at every odd level taken in the Artificer class. Your spellcasting ability is Intelligence. The spells you learn may not exceed the following chart.

items: {@b At 4th level}, you can learn 2nd level spells.
{@b At 7th level}, you can learn 3rd level spells.
{@b At 10th level}, you can learn 4th level spells.
{@b At 14th level}, you can learn 5th level spells.
{@b At 17th level}, you can learn 6th level spells.

subclassFeature.name: Arcane Spellcasting
entries: At 1st level you can cast any spell you know. (Spells and Schemas are different things) Doing so uses infusion points equal to twice the spell slot used, you may not use a higher spell slot then the highest spell level you can learn.
You also gain {@b Overcharge} (as per the 9th level ability)

entries.name: Preparing and Casting Spells
entries: The Artificer  table shows how many spell slots you have to cast your spells of 1st level and higher. To cast one of these spells, you must expend a slot of the spell's level or higher. You regain all expended spell slots when you finish a long rest.

You prepare the list of spells that are available for you to cast. To do so, choose a number of wizard spells from your spellbook equal to your Intelligence modifier + your wizard level (minimum of one spell). The spells must be of a level for which you have spell slots.

For example, if you're a 3rd-level wizard, you have four 1st-level and two 2nd-level spell slots. With an Intelligence of 16, your list of prepared spells can include six spells of 1st or 2nd level, in any combination, chosen from your spellbook. If you prepare the 1st-level spell {@spell magic missile}, you can cast it using a 1st-level or a 2nd-level slot. Casting the spell doesn't remove it from your list of prepared spells.

You can change your list of prepared spells when you finish a long rest. Preparing a new list of wizard spells requires time spent studying your spellbook and memorizing the incantations and gestures you must make to cast the spell: at least 1 minute per spell level for each spell on your list.

entries.name: Ritual Spellcasting:
entries: You can cast any spell you know as a ritual if that spell has the ritual tag. Doing so uses 1 infusion point regardless of its level.

entries.name: Arcane Adaptability:
entries: When you learn a spell you may instead learn a variant of that spell (chosen upon leveling up), if the spell does a damage type, you may cast a variant of the spell which does another form of damage or gives another equal condition (ie - deaf and silenced; converted to restrained and grappled) or requires a different Save (Dex vs Wis). You may develop a variant version of 1 spell at every even level taken in the Artificer class.

subclassFeature.name: Arcane Engineer's Additional Spell List
entries: You always have certain spells prepared after you reach particular levels in this class, as shown in the Arcane Engineer Spells table. These spells count as artificer spells for you, but they don't count against the number of artificer spells you prepare.

entries.caption: Arcane Engineer
rows: 1st
{@spell Shield}, {@spell Tenser's Floating Disc}, {@spell Detect Magic}, {@spell Identify},
4th
{@spell See Invisibilty}, {@spell Nystul's Magic Aura}, {@spell Knock}, {@spell Continual Flame}
7th
{@spell Tiny Servant}, {@spell Leomund's Tiny Hut}
10th
{@spell Freedom of Movement}, {@spell Mordenkainen's Private Sanctum}, {@spell Arcane Eye}
14th
{@spell Circle of Power}, {@spell Wall of Force}, {@spell Animate Objects}, {@spell Legend Lore}
17th
{@spell Primordial Ward}, {@spell Create Homunculus}, {@spell Guards and Wards},  {@spell Contingency}

subclassFeature.name: Arcane Implement
entries: At 3rd level, you craft an implement. The implement costs 500gp and takes 2 weeks to build. This implement can be an orb, a Medallion, a staff, a rod, a Libram, or a wand. Your implement grants certain benefits to spells cast through it, depending on the type of implement you've crafted.

items: {@b Libram of Versatility}: With each new level you gain you may choose to either gain a new spell or develop another variant.
{@b Medallion of Metamagic}: You gain one Metamagical ability from Sorcerer. Pay the costs in Infusion Points.

{@b Orb of Imposition}: You have advantage on Constitution saving throws made to maintain Concentration on a spell cast from your Orb of Imposition and you may cast a spell the requires an melee/touch attack roll on a willing recipient that you can touch -- casting the spell as normal but spending an additional Infusion point. The recipient thereafter become the "wielder" of that spell on their turn and can use it with their own attack/action rolls.
{@b Rod of Power}: You deal an extra point of damage per damage die.

{@b Staff of Defense}: When you cast a spell out of your Staff of Defense, choose one creature you can see. That creature has disadvantage on attack rolls made against you until the start of your next turn.
{@b Wand of Accuracy}: You add 1d4 to attack rolls of spells cast out of this implement.

subclassFeature.name: Unravel
entries: At 3rd level, as an action, you spend an infusion point and establish concentration - making an {@skill Arcana} Check against the caster's spell DC to suppress a spell's ongoing magical effect within 15ft until the beginning of your next round. The magical effect is merely interrupted, and resumes for its remaining duration.

items: {@b At 8th Level} ou may spend three (3) infusion points to either create the effect of a {@spell dispel magic|phb}, or spend your reaction to attempt to Unravel ({@spell Counterspell|phb}) the the spell as its being cast using an {@skill Arcana} check.

subclassFeature.name: Implement Adapatability
entries: At 6th level, you must choose Verbal or Somatic. When you cast through this implement you can't spend more points than your level maximum level of known spells, but yours spells cast through the object no longer require the chosen (verbal or somatic).
You also learn an additional cantrip from any list.

subclassFeature.name: Implement Expertise
entries: At 11th level, spells cast through your implement gain a +1 bonus to attack rolls, saving throw DC's.

subclassFeature.name: Implement Mastery
entries: At 14th level, your implement adds certain bonuses to spells cast through it, depending on the type of implement you've crafted.

items: {@b Libram of Versatility}: With each new level you gain you may choose to either gain a new spell or develop another variant.
{@b Medallion of Metamagic}: You gain one Metamagical ability from Sorcerer. Pay the costs in Infusion Points.
{@b Orb of Imposition}: You have advantage on Constitution saving throws made to maintain Concentration on a spell cast from your Orb of Imposition.
{@b Rod of Power}: You deal an extra point of damage per damage die.

{@b Staff of Defense}: When you cast a spell out of your Staff of Defense, choose one creature you can see. That creature has disadvantage on attack rolls made against you until the start of your next turn.
{@b Wand of Accuracy}: You add 1d4 to attack rolls of spells cast out of this implement.

subclassFeature.name: Implement Expertise
entries: At 18th level, spells cast through your implement gain a +2 bonus to attack rolls, saving throw DC's.

subclassFeature.name: Dweomer Absorption
entries: At 20th level, whenever you succeed on a saving throw and as a result that spell doesn't generate an effect (damage or impart a condition) You regain a number of infusion points equal to the spell slot used (cannot exceed the artificer's level maximum).

subclassFeature.name: Battlesmith
entries: Armies require protection, and someone has to put things back together if defenses fail. A combination of protector and medic, a Battle Smith is an expert at defending others and repairing both material and personnel. To aid in their work, Battle Smiths are usually accompanied by a steel defender, a protective companion of their own creation. Many soldiers tell stories of nearly dying before being saved by a Battle Smith and a steel defender.

Battle Smiths played a key role in House Cannith's work on battle constructs and the original warforged, and after the Last War, these artificers led efforts to aid those who were injured in the war's horrific battles.

subclassFeature.name: Bonus Proficiency
entries: You gain proficiency with: all Martial weapons and Heavy Armor; and {@item Smith's Tools|PHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Bonus Cantrip
entries: You gain one cantrip from the following list; {@spell Green Flame Blade|PHB}, {@spell Blade Ward|PHB}, {@spell Shillelagh|PHB}, or {@spell Sword Burst|PHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Bonus Infusions
entries: You gain 1 Constant type Infusion with each level.

items: {@b At 1st}, You learn the Magic Armor, Clockwork Iron Defender and Magic Weapon Infusions.
{@b At 5th level}, you learn either Elemental Resistance or the Vengeance Weapon Infusions.
{@b At 9th level}, you learn Protective Armor Infusion.
{@b At 13th level}, you learn Quickened Weapon Infusion.
{@b At 17th level}, you learn Antimagic Armor Infusion.

subclassFeature.name: Battle Ready
entries: When you reach 3rd level, your combat training and your experiments with magic have paid off in two ways:

items: You gain proficiency with martial weapons.
When you attack with a magic weapon, you can use your Intelligence modifier, instead of Strength or Dexterity modifier, for the attack and damage rolls.

subclassFeature.name: Extra Attack
entries: Starting at 6th level, you can attack twice, rather than once, whenever you take the {@action Attack} action on your turn.

subclassFeature.name: Signature Enchantment
entries: At 11th level you may choose up to 5 Infusion Points of a single Infusion. The Infusion must be one that affects a weapon or armor. You thereafter lose those infusion points until your next level, but any Infused weapon/armor you wield that you've created gains that Infusion as well at no additional cost. Each level you may reassign those points to a different infusion.

items: {@b At 17th level}, you may choose up to 8 points for the Infusion.

entries: For example, an 11th level Battle Engineer chooses to have the Signature Enchantment of Elemental Weapon (fire), When they wield an infused greatsword with Bleeding Weapon.  Greatsword is infused by both Bleeding Weapon and Elemental Weapon(fire).

subclassFeature.name: Mass Enchantment
entries: At 14th level, all allies within 60 feet of you gain the benefit of your Battle Engineer Signature Enchantment, when they wield one of your infused weapons/armor.

subclassFeature.name: Arcane Army
entries: At 18th level, allies within 150 feet of you may attune themselves to a fourth magic item. This magic item must be a weapon or armor. If your allies are not within 150 feet of you, they cease to gain the benefits of being attuned with that item

subclassFeature.name: Arcane Defender
entries: At 20th level, You Clockwork Iron Defender Grows Grows to a Mecha Defender, and can acts as your mount.

subclassFeature.name: Clockwork Engineer
entries: Clockwork Engineers are masters of the automata. Bringing springs, gears and wires to life. Mirroring life's wonders thru their tinkering.

When an Automaton Infusion created by you and synced to you is reduced to 0 hit points, it is rendered inert instead of destroyed. It doesn't need to make death saves, but if it's attacked further you will need to take 10 minutes more for each additional assault to restore it's function. If the automaton was dropped to 0 hp after the end of your last turn, you your Turn, as an action and can get into the square with the downed automaton, for two infusion point, you can return the Automaton to functional with 1 hit point.

entries.name: Bonus Proficiency
entries: You gain proficiency with Tinkerer's Kit. If you already have this proficiency, you gain expertise.

entries.name: Bonus Schema
entries: You have the Animate Object Schema.

entries.name: Bonus Infusion
entries: You gain no additional infusions with each level.

items: {@b At 1st level}, you learn the Arbalest Infusion.
{@b At 5th level}, you learn Clockwork Bomb.
{@b At 9th level, you learn Total Repair.

subclassFeature.name: Multiclass Synergy
entries: If your character is able to cast a Conjuring / Summon of creatures, or {@spell find familiar|phb} spell - while these may traditionally brings a celestial, beast, fey, or fiend. However; if you cast such a spell, where you can choose forms for your summoned/familiar creature, it is always a construct instead of a beast (or celestial, beast, fey, or fiend). It resembles the chosen creature, but is make of clockwork gears, screws, wires, hinges and plates. The summoned creatures are immune to {@condition charmed} condition, and resistant to Poison damage.

subclassFeature.name: Clockwork Companion
entries: At 3rd Level When an Automaton Infusion created by and synced to you is reduced to 0 hit points, it is rendered inert instead of destroyed. It doesn't need to make death saves, but if it's attacked further you will need to take 10 minutes more for each additional assault to restore it's function.

You may have up to ½ your Artificer Level worth of Constructs operative - (though you may never have more than your Charisma Bonus under your control at one time. {@i (all action economy is maintained)})

subclassFeature.name: Autonomy
entries: At 3rd Level, Autonomous Engineer's can assign the Automaton(s) to take the {@b Guard}, or {@b Evade}, Actions, which they will continue doing so until ordered to stop.

items: {@b Evade}. Attacks against the Automaton are at disadvantage, if attacked on its next turn it will disengage and takes its move to get away from combat, it will continue to move this way until not attacked for a turn, at which point it will then return.

{@b Guard}. Assign the Automaton a creature or 15ftx15ft cube to watch over. When a creature either attacks creature or a creature not designated by its Sync'd owner enters the space, it attacks them.

{@b At 5th level}. Automatons gain an Semi-Autonomous Command interpreter. As an Bonus Action you command your Automaton (a single Automaton or a designated sync'd group) to perform a simple a full action command (attack, dash, evade, etc) which it will repeat (ie attack that creature, dig a hole, walk between these points) until attempting the task becomes impossible, it's sync'd companion or creator is killed, or it is given another command. {@i The DM interprets the command's execution unless you specifically are micromanaging (in which case any action/bonus/reaction the automaton uses, so do you)}.

{@b At 7th Level}. your synced Automatons execute one additional attack when performing an attack action (May not exceed 3 attack actions a round), if you wish you may now use either a bonus action or a reaction action to modify the semi autonomous command action. Or as a full action you may give two command actions; (commanding different automatons/groups.)
{@b At 17th level}. your commands may consist of up to your Int Bonus number of Stacked commands. {@b Example:}
(1st Priority) Defend Unconscious Ally
(2nd Priority) Kill Designated Creature
(3rd Priority) Assist Closest Ally (Grant Help)

entries.name: Same As Above
entries: In that a total of 9 words convey that the Automaton should defend an unconscious ally, (and if none exists), attack a designated creature until it's dead (or until an ally is brought to unconsciousness - at which point the Automaton would disengage and defend the body of the ally), however if the initial target is killed before an ally is dropped to 0 hp. It would move to the closest ally and mirror its engagement (attempting a skill). The DM should limit the number of words the player can use to make them VERY cautious of wording of such.

subclassFeature.name: Infuse Automaton
entries: At 6th level, you can infuse an Automaton with infusions that can target a weapon or armor. You still cannot exceed your level for Infusion Maximum on the total number of points invested in your Automaton.  Additionally, if you can cast spells, You may now also cast any spell with self as the target on one of your sync'd Automatons.

subclassFeature.name: Sync
entries: At 11th level, you can sync with multiple Automatons at one time (Each takes 1 attunement slot, but you may never have more than your Charisma Ability Modifier (minimum 1)).

subclassFeature.name: Reinforced Automaton
entries: At 14th level, when you create an Automaton or restore it to its full hit points, that Automaton gains 20 temporary hit points.

subclassFeature.name: Automaton Artistry
entries: Choose between one of the following:

items: {@b Lifelike Automaton}. Your skill transcends into artistry - your Automaton's gain proficiency with Deception (+10) for the purposes of appearing to be living creatures, They gain speech (limitedly) and their movements and behavior are disturbingly realistic. Cost of the automatons is doubled. They retain their abilities which often will clearly demonstrate them to be constructs, but a horse, dog, or even child will appear real to the casual inspection. Your Automatons gain +2 bonus to their Intelligence,Wisdom, and a +6 to Charisma ability scores.
{@b Adamantine Automaton}. Your Automaton's gain a +2 bonus on their AC, STRength, DEXterity, and CONsitution ability scores, and gain +10 movement.

subclassFeature.name: Mystic Sage
entries: Ten Artifier skupia się na tworzeniu dóbr. Prace pisemne w szczególności, a w walce jest fatalny.

subclassFeature.name: Bonus Proficiency
entries: You gain proficiency with two of the following artisan kit/tools; {@item Calligraphy Supplies|phb}, {@item Carpenter's Tools|phb}, {@item Cook's Utensils|phb}, {@item Painter's Kit|phb}, {@item Potter's Tools|phb}, {@item Weaver's|Weaver's Tools|phb}, {@item , and Woodworker's Tools|phb}. If you already have this proficiency, you gain proficiency with one other type of artisan's tools of your choice.

subclassFeature.name: Bonus Cantrip
entries: You learn 2 Cantrips from the Following List: {@spell Message|phb}, {@spell Guidance|phb}, or {@spell Mage Hand|phb}.

subclassFeature.name: Bonus Infusions
entries: You gain one additional infusion of the type Artistic/Wonderous with each level.

items: {@b At 1st level}, you learn Quill of Longwritting and Quill of Dictation.
{@b At 3rd level}, you learn Wand of... and Rune Infusions.
{@b At 5th level}, you learn Reading Glasses, and Cynic's Goggles.
{@b At 7th level}, you learn Goggles of Truesight and Quill of Law.
{@b At 11th level}, you learn Rune of Shadowtendril.
{@b At 17th level}, you learn Bottled Storm.

subclassFeature.name: ReCharged
entries: At 1st level, You may, as a bonus action, use 1 infusion point + 2 points per spell slot level to grant a magic item with a Temporary single charge.

items: {@b At 6th level}, you reduce the infusion cost of making a wand, stave, rod by 1 point (You still may not exceed your Max Infusion cost).

{@b At 12th level}, if you put a charge into an item that broke within the last hour as a result of expending its last charge, you may repair it. (effectively a revify for charged magical items). When you do this, rather than your overcharge granting an additional charge, it returns the item's ability to gain more charges the next day.

entries.name: Alternate Rules:
entries: The Artificer must have one or all of the schema(s) necessary to recharge the item to use this ability.

subclassFeature.name: Enduring Enchantment
entries: {@i (This grants early access of the Enduring Enchantment received at 6th level)}

At 1st level, when you create an infusion you may choose to enhance the dweomer making it last one day.  Doing so costs the Artificer dearly.  In addition to the Infusion point costs the artificer reduces their Maximum Health by that same amount as well as take a point of Constitution damage.  You may not regain the Infusion Point(s), CONstitution damage, and damage from Maximum HP until either the item(s) are broken, used or a week has passed.

items: {@b At 6th level}, you may add infusions points to an Enduring Enchantment, taking it further - you may not add more Infusions points than your Maximum Infusion and your infusions last up to a week.
{@b At 12th Level}, you no longer take Constitution damage when you craft an enduring enchantment.

subclassFeature.name: Expeditious Enchanter
entries: At 5th level, you may effect you daily crafting productivity from 25gp a day (DMG pg. 129) for magical goods with your Infusion points. So that at 5th level they would have 35gp productivity of work a day for magical goods. (and from 5 gp a day for mundane to 15gp a day)

subclassFeature.name: Increased Infusions
entries: At 11th level, your Maximum Infusion Pool in increased by (2 x INTelligence bonus.)

subclassFeature.name: Frugal Fabricator
entries: Starting at 9th level, every eldritch cannon you create is more destructive:

items: At 14th level, the costs (gold) for the infusions is ½ the listed expense and 1 less Infusion point (Minimum 1 pt) - provided you are able to work on your project for 2 hours each day your work is not lost.

subclassFeature.name: Phantom Blade
entries: Some rogues choose to focus their training on ways to blend magical talent with their rogue talents. Over time, this training gave way to a group of rogues that learned how to create and use a personal extradimensional space to support their talents. At first, this space was used to stash useful and important items from prying eyes and wandering hands. As these rogues developed greater and more fine-tuned ability to manipulate this space, a new form of attack took shape. Because of the peculiar and distinctive nature of this attack, these rogues came to be known as phantom blades.

subclassFeature.name: Spellcasting
entries: When you reach 3rd level, you gain the ability to cast spells. See {@book chapter 10|PHB|10} for the general rules of spellcasting and chapter 11 for the {@filter warlock spell list|spells|class=warlock}.

entries.name: Cantrips
entries: You learn three cantrips: {@spell phantom stash|phtm}, {@spell phantom recall|phtm} and {@spell phantom blade|phtm} at 3rd level.
At 7th level, 11th, and 15th level you gain an additional cantrip.

entries.name: Spell Slots
entries: The Phantom Blade table shows how many spell slots you have. The table also shows what the level of those slots is; all of your spell slots are the same level. To cast one of your Phantom Blade spells of 1st level or higher, you must expend a spell slot. You regain all expended spell slots when you finish a short or long rest. For example, when you are 7th level, you have two 3rd-level spell slots. To cast the 1st-level spell {@spell witch bolt|PhB}, you must spend one of those slots, and you cast it as a 3rd-level spell.

entries.name: Spells Known of 1st-Level and Higher
entries: You know one 1st-level warlock spell of your choice. The Spells Known column of the Phantom Blade Spellcasting table shows when you learn more warlock spells of 1st level or higher. Each of these spells must be a conjuration or enchantment spell of your choice and must be of a level for which you have spell slots. For instance, when you reach 7th level in this class, you can learn one new spell of 1st or 2nd level. Whenever you gain a level in this class, you can replace one of the warlock spells you know with another spell of your choice from the warlock spell list. The new spell must be of a level for which you have spell slots, and it must be a conjuration or enchantment.

entries.name: Spellcasting Ability
entries: Charisma is your spellcasting ability for your warlock spells, so you use your Charisma whenever a spell refers to your spellcasting ability. In addition, you use your Charisma modifier when selling the saving throw DC for a warlock spell you cast and when making an attack roll with one.

subclassFeature.name: Phantom Zone
entries: At 3rd level, you develop connection to an extra dimensional pocket that only you can access. This pocket space is separate from your inventory and can contain 2 lbs or 8 cubic feet of content. The contents do not count against your encumbrance. If the character dies, their pocket dimension collapses and its contents are lost to Astral Space.
This space grows an additional 1 lb. per level, and a larger container at 5th (16 ft.³), 11th(27 ft.³) and 42 ft.³ cubic feet at 17th level.

subclassFeature.name: Phantom Augmentations
entries: You develop augmentations which agument your phantasmal space abilities. At 4th level, you gain a phantasmal augmentation of your choice. Your augmentations options are detailed at the end of the class description. When you gain certain phantom blade levels, you gain additional agumentations of your choice, as shown in the Augmentations Known column of the Phantom Blade table.

subclassFeature.name: Magical Ambush
entries: At 9th level, at the end of your round, if you hit a creature with your phantom blade ability, you can choose to manifest a ghostly image of the weapon you used to make the attack. This manifested blade must appear adjacent to the creature you hit. If your attack hit multiple creatures, you choose which square adjacent of one of those creatures your manifested blade appears. The manifest blade counts an ally using the help action and so grants advantage to attacks against its chosen creature. They only last until the end of your next turn.
{@monster Manifest Blade|phtm}

It uses your saves and if your manifested blade is subjected to an effect that allows a Dexterity save for half damage, it instead takes no damage on a successful save. If an enemy would provoke an opportunity attack from your manifested blade, you can use your reaction to direct it to attack that enemy. Using this ability does not require any additional action, but it does occupy your concentration while active. If you attempt to use this ability while it is already active, all currently manifested blades vanish before any new manifested blades appear.

subclassFeature.name: Opportunistic Reaction
entries: At 13th level, you gain the ability to build off even small advantages, if you have advantage on a creature that exposes itself to an Attack of Opportunity from you, if the weapon allows for such, you may also apply sneak damage. At 13th level, your Manifest Blade gain the ability to build off even small advantages, if a creature within range of the Manifest Blade moves out of its threaten space and evokes an attack of opportunity - you no long need to use your reaction for the Manifest Blade to make its attack - it does so separately. The Manifest blade deals sneak attack damage on a successful strike. While manifested, the blades now (Rogue's choice) Either:

items: {@b Parry}: dancing about they impose disadvantage on the creature's next attack, or
{@b Distract}: grant advantage on the next attack against the creature. (It still remains an ally for the purposes of Rogue sneak attack or pack tactics.

subclassFeature.name: Phantom Ambush
entries: At 17th level, your manifest blade ability improves. If your attack hits multiple creatures, you can now manifest a ghostly image of your weapon adjacent to each of them. If any enemy provokes an opportunity attack from a manifested blade, you can use your reaction your attack of opportunity against an enemy that leaves a space your weapon threatens.
